answerText: gluon[10] Gluons are part of quantum chromodynamics, a theory that explains the strong force much like quantum electrodynamics explains the electromagnetic force. This property in QCD is analogous to charge in QED. It comes in red, green, and blue varieties.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 5 | 20 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This particle is the carrier of the strong force and it holds hadrons and baryons together. For 10 points each: [10] Name this spin-1 particle. Hypothetical hadrons made entirely of them are called glueballs.
